title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 71.2 - Examination papers not to be exhibited; exceptions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 71.2 - Examination papers not to be exhibited; exceptions

State Regulations
A candidate's papers may not be exhibited except as provided
in section
71.1
of this Part, and in
regulation four [FN2]; provided, however, that the administrative director may, upon request, authorize the inspection of a candidate's application and other
papers, for legitimate official purposes, by law enforcement and other
officials or their representatives, where there appear satisfactory and
compelling reasons for the need for such inspection. [FN2] Regulation four repealed Sept. 17, 1959. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4
ยง
71.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
